Post.title: rush+pnpm
Post._content:
### rush - Rush makes life easier for JavaScript developers who build and publish many packages from a common Git repo. If you're looking to break up your giant application into smaller pieces, and you already realized why it doesn't work to put each package in a separate repo... then Rush is for you! ### rush - 1.Ready for large repos - 2.Designed for large teams - 3.No phantom dependencies! - 4.No NPM doppelgangers! - 5.Easy to administer - 6.Turnkey solution - 7.Open model ### rush - 1.npmrushpnpm ```shell npm i -g @microsoft/rush npm i -g pnpm ``` - 2.rush init - rush.jsonvscodeJSONJSON with Comments ![avatar](/img/rush1.webp) ![avatar](/img/rush2.webp) ![avatar](/img/rush3.webp) - 3.rushapps,create-react-appreact,rush.jsonprojects,rush update ```shell npx create-react-app manage-package --template typescript ``` ```json { "packageName": "manage-package", "projectFolder": "apps/manage-package" }, ``` - 4.cd apps/manage-package rushx startreact - 5.cd .. libs,cdlibs,tsdxreact,rush.jsonprojects,packageNamepackage.jsonnamepackage.jsonname@shared/onecomponent,onecomponent/src/index.t,divonecomponent ```ts import * as React from 'react'; // Delete me export const Thing = () => { return
onecomponent
; }; ``` ```shell npx tsdx create onecomponent ``` ```json { "packageName": "@shared/onecomponent", "projectFolder": "libs/onecomponent" } ``` - 6.cd rush update --purge - 7.reactrush add,rush addrush build rush rebuild ```shell rush add --package @shared/onecomponent ``` - 8.manage-packageApp.ts@shared/onecomponent ```ts import React from 'react'; import logo from './logo.svg'; import './App.css'; import { Thing } from '@shared/onecomponent'; function App() { return (

Edit src/App.tsx and save to reload.

Learn React
); } ``` ![avatar](/img/rush5.webp) - 9.
Post.raw:
--- title: rush+pnpm cover: /img/rush.webp --- ### rush - Rush makes life easier for JavaScript developers who build and publish many packages from a common Git repo. If you're looking to break up your giant application into smaller pieces, and you already realized why it doesn't work to put each package in a separate repo... then Rush is for you! ### rush - 1.Ready for large repos - 2.Designed for large teams - 3.No phantom dependencies! - 4.No NPM doppelgangers! - 5.Easy to administer - 6.Turnkey solution - 7.Open model ### rush - 1.npmrushpnpm ```shell npm i -g @microsoft/rush npm i -g pnpm ``` - 2.rush init - rush.jsonvscodeJSONJSON with Comments ![avatar](/img/rush1.webp) ![avatar](/img/rush2.webp) ![avatar](/img/rush3.webp) - 3.rushapps,create-react-appreact,rush.jsonprojects,rush update ```shell npx create-react-app manage-package --template typescript ``` ```json { "packageName": "manage-package", "projectFolder": "apps/manage-package" }, ``` - 4.cd apps/manage-package rushx startreact - 5.cd .. libs,cdlibs,tsdxreact,rush.jsonprojects,packageNamepackage.jsonnamepackage.jsonname@shared/onecomponent,onecomponent/src/index.t,divonecomponent ```ts import * as React from 'react'; // Delete me export const Thing = () => { return
onecomponent
; }; ``` ```shell npx tsdx create onecomponent ``` ```json { "packageName": "@shared/onecomponent", "projectFolder": "libs/onecomponent" } ``` - 6.cd rush update --purge - 7.reactrush add,rush addrush build rush rebuild ```shell rush add --package @shared/onecomponent ``` - 8.manage-packageApp.ts@shared/onecomponent ```ts import React from 'react'; import logo from './logo.svg'; import './App.css'; import { Thing } from '@shared/onecomponent'; function App() { return (

Edit src/App.tsx and save to reload.

Learn React
); } ``` ![avatar](/img/rush5.webp) - 9.
Post.content:
rush

  • Rush makes life easier for JavaScript developers who build and publish many packages from a common Git repo. If youre looking to break up your giant application into smaller pieces, and you already realized why it doesnt work to put each package in a separate repo then Rush is for you!

rush

  • 1.Ready for large repos
  • 2.Designed for large teams
  • 3.No phantom dependencies!
  • 4.No NPM doppelgangers!
  • 5.Easy to administer
  • 6.Turnkey solution
  • 7.Open model

rush

  • 1.npmrushpnpm

  • 2.rush init

    • rush.jsonvscodeJSONJSON with Comments



  • 3.rushapps,create-react-appreact,rush.jsonprojects,rush update

  • 4.cd apps/manage-package rushx startreact

  • 5.cd .. libs,cdlibs,tsdxreact,rush.jsonprojects,packageNamepackage.jsonnamepackage.jsonname@shared/onecomponent,onecomponent/src/index.t,divonecomponent

  • 6.cd rush update purge

  • 7.reactrush add,rush addrush build rush rebuild

  • 8.manage-packageApp.ts@shared/onecomponent

  • 9.

Post.title: pm2+ts-nodenode
Post.content:
pm2

PM2

PM2 is a daemon process manager that will help you manage and keep your application online. Getting started with PM2 is straightforward, it is offered as a simple and intuitive CLI, installable via NPM.

pm2ts-nodenode

ts-node

pm2

  • cpu

pm2node

nodejs

ps -aux | grep node

cpu8node

localhost:8000node
